name: Scatterbox "June 1st, 2013" Limited Edition CD.
description: Limited edition live CD recording straight from the soundboard and featuring new previously unreleased songs.  Limited to 100 copies, all CD's are hand assembled and hand numbered, and come with a track listing/tray card, a new sticker design, and a pre-sale ticket from the night of the show.

name: Cave In "Anchor" 7" (Marble vinyl).
description: Limited quantity available - Limited edition single from Boston legends by-way-of-Hydra Head Records band Cave In.  Songs taken from their RCA debut "Antenna".

name: Majority Rule "Interviews With David Frost" LP (Pink Vinyl).
description: Interviews With David Frost album by Majority Rule was released May 22, 2001 on the Magic Bullet label. Evil -- pure metallic evil. Interviews With David Frost music CDs On this seven-track debut, Majority Rule fuses speedy metal riffing with hardcore screams and spooky breakdowns to produce a nightmare of a record -- a good thing, depending on how you look at it. Recorded by one of the gurus of the genre, Brian McTernan, at his Salad Days studio, Interviews With David Frost is a spectacle of perfect-sounding distorted guitars that chug along toward a sinister future. Interviews With David Frost songs The guttural howls shift occasionally into At the Drive-In-type screams, but it's never long before the band gives up on chilling out, and then the real intensity begins. This disc is a bit more complicated than the average hardcore disc, and the musicianship is obviously impeccable from start to finish. Still, anyone who isn't a fan of the style won't likely be won over, but for those who dig chaotic sounds of the future, this is all you'd ever need.

name: Lair of The Minotaur "War Metal Battle Master" DVD
description: Lair of the Minotaur ain't playing around, folks. And Southern Lord's not, either. This DVD is what we need more of in the metal market. There's nothing cheap here. It's all well made. And what was this other reviewer looking for? Not what you'd expect?! It's exactly what I'd expect! And that's why Lair of the Minotaur is one of the most unsung metal bands out there. While so many other bands are over-exposed with much weaker material, these guys are grinding out metal that's dying to be heard. And this proves they can put on one hell of a show, folks. Some needs to listen up and get these guys on a major, major tour. Of course, they might be scared they'd have a hard time following them. Nice metal, scenes with very nice flesh, what more could you ask for? Big metal horns to the sky on this one!

name: Orthodox "Amanecer en Puerta Oscura" CD
description:
In December 2006,ORTHODOX' recorded this, their second album "Amanecer en Puerta Oscura". The album helps give a new perspective into the soul of the music they create as well as its movement into several different directions.

"Amanecer en Puerta Oscura" comes off like a trip crossing through different genres, where jazz influences, collide with progressive sounds and ultra-heavy, crushing metallic-punk experiments. At the same time the band has not forgotten their true metal roots and Andalusian cultural origins. The use of new instrumentation (clarinet, trumpet, contrabass), fits naturally with the band's original sound yet opens a new window in order to see the light within their dark musical concept. 

ORTHODOX are continually searchinng for new and diverse forms of music expressions, "Amanecer en Puerta Oscura" is a logical manifestation of their current "discoveries" during this quest.

name: The Accused "The Curse of Martha Splatterhead" CD
description:
"The Curse of Martha Splatterhead brings us up to date with a band still going after 28 years. To say that their fire has waned would be hugely inaccurate â€“ The Curse of Martha Splatterhead is a ridiculously frenetic and enjoyable album. For the most part, the pace here is an unrelenting display of speed. Drum patterns mix the frenzied but controlled approach youâ€™d expect to find on a Slayer album. The Curse of Martha Splatterhead is an invigorating listen from start to finish. It doesnâ€™t get more cathartic than this."

-Sam Shepard

name: Oren Ambarchi "Triste" CD
description:
I'm a relative newcomer to Australian guitarist Oren Ambarchi, but after hearing two solo albums and one collaboration, it seems clear that he doesn't like to repeat himself. He moves easily between moods and textures, from spacious ambient plucking to abrasive drones, and at this premature stage in my exploration of his discography, his truly experimental style is still difficult to pin down.

This gorgeously packaged album contains a full live set, 40 minutes or so, recorded in Holland in 2001, along with a seven-inch EP containing two "remakes" by Tom Recchion. Sounds are by Ambarchi alone, using his guitar augmented by some basic processing and electronics. The show was presumably in a gallery or theater, because the vast pockets of space that Ambarchi leaves between the notes (especially on the first side) are filled by silence alone. No background noise is detected.

The calm is important, as Ambarchi's preferred technique on the A-side is to move between a small handful of tones, where he plucks a single guitar string and lets the sound slowly decay alongside prickly electric scrapes and pops. He alternates between a half-dozen or so notes, with silence predominating in the early going and sounds congregating into progressively dense clusters as time passes.

Because of the seemingly random movement between the small set of pitches, the first side is oddly reminiscent of wind chimes, sounding like a peculiar amplified version of a hanging clutch of tubular bells. There's a sensation that something other than two hands is causing the notes to sound, some silent and unknowable force setting things in motion and then moving in and around the vibrations. Because the music is still surprising and unpredictable after ten spins, Triste makes for excellent repeated listening.

Both the sound and approach changes on the second side. It definitely starts where the piece left off, but the tempo is accelerated and more urgent, and sub-bass drones intrude and then take over almost immediately. The crackling taps that accompanied the drawn-out notes remains, but slowly shifting layers of sound and feedback are the focus. The rumbling bottom end combined with nasally, flanged harmonics bring to mind a chorus of didgeridoos, and then the midrange swells imparts the sonority of dueling sine waves. In the piece's final half, wild electronic tones untraceable to a guitar bang in and out, buzzing around the space like large sheet metal insects.

Where the first side left ample space for contemplation, allowing the listener to make a minute dissection of each sound, the harshly textured blasts come and go far more quickly by the end of the show than they can be processed. Triste goes from Thursday Afternoon-style ambience to Mego-ish noise, and then, for a minute or two at the very end, back again. It's a mesmerizing ride.

The remakes by Recchion are excellent. Ambarchi's bell-like tones are prominent, but rather than focusing on a particular aspect of the original piece, Recchion uses the material to construct something new. Playing against the seeming randomness of Ambarchi's pieces, Recchion adds anchoring drones and sequences, thereby softening the material and making it more conventionally musical. Recchion's treatments are deeply affecting, occasionally even bordering on the sentimental, which is amazing considering the coolly removed nature of the source. All in all, Triste is a deeply satisfying exploration of abstract sound

-Pitchfork

name: Boris "Smile" CD
description:
With this brand new studio album from Boris' the group plays deeply intense blistering psychedelia with mammoth hooks and truly innovative song-writing. Smile is a reinvention of dark heaviness. Smile presents a new sound from Boris which represents everything that is RIGHT NOW.

Boris hope "this is going to be a new experience for everyone beyond music.
'Features collaborations with special guests: Stephen O'Malley (sunn0))), KTL), and Michio Kurihara (Ghost, White Heaven, The Stars). The Southern Lord version is drastically different than the version of Smile released by Daymare records in Japan. The main difference between the Southern Lord version and the Daymare version is the mix of the actual songs themselves. Where the songs on the Japanese version have a more electronic or noisy-psychedelic vibe, the North American/European version here features a heavier more straight-forward rock aesthetic. Its truly remarkable how the band consciously have set out (and achieved) to make two completely different sounding versions of the same album. It is a testament to their continual, endless well-spring of creativity!

name: Pig Destoyer "Painter of Dead Girls" CD
description: Comprised of highly sought-out, early and obscure material from Virginian cult-favorites Pig Destroyer, this collection disc serves as a window into the twisted minds of true grind-fueled madmen. Brutal riff upon riff overlay some of the fastest yet most intricate and stylish drums in the grind game, all conjoined with some of the most manic and terrifying screams ever captured by recording implements. The fact that this band is only a three-piece is nothing short of mind-boggling, and by seamlessly weaving the majority of heavy music genres (thrash, punk rock, heavy metal, grindcore, death metal, technical mathy hardcore, etc.), itâ€™s no real surprise that these guys are often hailed as the kings of modern heavy music.

name: Torche "S/T" CD (Remixed, Reissued).
description:
Once described as "stoner pop", Miami quartet TORCHE could just as awkwardly be called "doom pop" or "thunder rock"... but what all these clumsy words boil down to is simultaneously one of the catchiest AND heaviest bands to ever grace the worlds of metal, indie and underground music in general. Sound like hyperbole? TORCHE actually has their own patented "bomb string" tuning which is literally unparalleled in heavy music (past or present) and they use it liberally on this, their self-titled debut full-length album.

Easily the heaviest record Robotic Empire has released to date, never has a "metal" album existed quite like the mind-blowing debut release from TORCHE. Hinted at by members' former group FLOOR, truly anthemic, triumphant and absolutely massive heavy metal has never been this undeniably catchy! With gloriously sung, harmonized and soaring vocal arrangements accompanying the most monolithic riffs of modern times, TORCHE reaches to push the envelope and then engulfs it in flames. Call it "stoner pop"or "exquisite brutality"... call it whatever you want. In the end, TORCHE are still a major force to fuck with, and undeniable leaders of an incredible new style of heavy music.

This is the deluxe, fully re-mixed and re-mastered edition of TORCHE's debut album... which has been completely reworked from the ground up due to the band's overall dissatisfaction with the original release. This new version is a much more accurate representation of the band with an even heavier (and clearer) mix than the original, also containing an all new bonus track originally recorded during the initial tracking (but only recently receiving some absolutely epic vocal treatment) and expanded artwork. Robotic Empire is genuinely proud to re-release this incredible debut album!

name: A Life Once Lost "The Fourth Plague: Flies" CDEP
description: Philadelphia, PA's A LIFE ONCE LOST have grown into one of the major forces to reckon with in the current metal and hardcore scenes, but before working with Deathwish and their signing to Ferret, there was the fierce, groundbreaking EP making waves. Entitled The Fourth Plague: Flies, this CDep contains five tracks that showcases a phenomenal era of this true beast of a band. With more Swedish melodic metal influence than their current style, The Fourth Plague: Flies is a pioneering mix of furious metal coupled with monstrous hardcore elements, including some of the fiercest breakdowns imaginable. With mastering tuneups by Scott Hull (PIG DESTROYER) and striking new artwork by Aaron Turner (ISIS), A LIFE ONCE LOST's breakthrough EP stands strong as a truly innovative creation and many of their older fans' favorite release.

name: V/A "Cry Now Cry Later Vol. 3 & 4" CD.
description: Super rare and long out of print CD compilation originally released on Pessimiser.  These are the original pessimiser pressing and features hard to find songs by CROM, Agoraphobic Nosebleed, Divisia, Man Is The Bastard, Spazz, Charles Bronson, and many more.  Limited quantities available.

name: 16 "Scott Case" CD (Rare Material).
description: Long out of print CD originally released on Pessimiser.  Limited quantity available.

name: Fishsticks "Disko" CD
description: Long out of print CD collection of this amazing old school Southern California hardcore punk band.  Originally released on Theologian.  Limited quantity available.

name: Phobia "Destroying The Masses" 10".
description: Long out of print legendary 10" originally released on Pessimiser.  Limited quantity available.

name: The Freeze/Bollweevils Split 10"
description: Two of the countries Greatest PUNK bands together on one 10"!!!  Long out of print from Dr. Strange Records, this is a total score, and we just landed a few of these here in the warehouse.

name: Hoods "The King Is Dead" LP (Black/Green Splatter Vinyl).
description: "The King is Dead" is a call to arms for all of those who have grown tired watching hc be exploited and bastardized.  Limited Edition pressing on black and green splatter vinyl.

name: DIAL "Self-Titled" CDep.
description:
The old expression "like a ton of bricks" doesn't even come close here. The weight of a mountain is what DIAL drops on you with their absolutely crushing 5-song debut EP. The austere New Zealand outfit originally self-released this as a demo, but the material contained within is leaps and bounds beyond what most bands accomplish even at their best. DIAL successfully channels the darkest corners of the AmRep catalog, the raw ferocity of classic hardcore, offtime kilter of math-rock, and the whole concept that music can actually be dangerous.

The air-tight composure of DIAL's debut recording is striking; focusing more on space and dissonance than technical shreddery. Obscenely heavy guitars collide with bludgeoning percussion and intense, vicious and scathing female vocals... turning the whole thing into a downright terrifying experience. Add an incredibly crisp recording, and this makes DIAL's debut EP one of the most impressive demos we've heard in years, let alone had the privilege to re-release.

name: Scatterbox "Vice" T-Shirt.
description: New Scatterbox shirt designed in house by the Blackhouse folks.  Available in S, M, L, and XL.  Please specify size in notes upon ordering.

name: Now Denial "Brothers Not Fighting" 7" (Black Vinyl).
description: The first release from MA's Now Denial. This record features two songs that were home recorded by the band and showcases the raw sound that is a Now Denial live show. Also, this release has an early version of "We Got The Bullets...Let's Make Some Holes" (you can hear the newer version on Power To The Mountain).

name: Dead Western 7" (out of print, clear vinyl).
description: We got our hands on a handful of these a while back and just uncovered them in the move!  Totally bizarre hand-silkscreened covers and clear vinyl!  This has been long out of print and probably will go down as one of the most obscure releases we have ever had in our store.  Get it now before it's gone FOREVER.

name: Scatterbox Ten Year Anniversary Show Poster (limited ed. of 50).
description: In celebration of Scatterbox hitting the big 1-0, a very limited run of 50 posters were made for the show.  There are only a handful of these left, as most were sold at the ten year anniversary show.  These prints are hand silkscreened, signed and numbered by the artist, and measure 16"x28".

name: VERSOMA "Life During Wartime" LP COLORED VINYL
description:
MUDSLIDE COLORED VINYL.  LIMITED TO 200 COPIES.  

The influence of independent and alternative music's celebrated past is undeniable on VERSOMA's six-track, 18-minute debut EP... but with plenty of aggression and passion retained from years in the punk/metal/hardcore underground. With members having done time in LICKGOLDENSKY, ANODYNE, HOT CROSS, ORCHID and more, one might expect chaotic screaming madness, but (fortunately) this is a wall of guitars mixed with desperate, wailing and haunting vocals; darkness mixed with simplistic genius, and the manic quality control of three different label owners involved. Recorded at Translator Audio with band-member Mike Hill and mastered at West West Side by Alan Douches, the first sonic offering from VERSOMA is an exciting step towards uncharted audio territories, and an excellent indication of things to come.

name: HOLY SONS "Decline of The West" LP
description:
Emil Amos is Holy Sons. Since arriving initially during the early 90â€™s home recording boom, he has appeared and disappeared again over the course of 8 solo records, never touring until now. Holy Sonsâ€™ minimalist avant-folk sound journeys through formats as varied as dub, church-hymn, slow-jam and tape-collage; deconstructing virtually any genre with a spontaneous punk spirit. The music is organic, dark and beautiful, documenting a constantly evolving songwriter who possesses a unique gift for distinctive and prolific artistry. Outside of Holy Sons, Emil has two other globally renowned bands: â€˜Omâ€™ (Drag City), and â€˜Grailsâ€™ (Temporary Residence/Important Records). He has performed both on stages and collaboratively with the likes of Daniel Johnston, Jandek, Damo Suzuki, J Mascis, Will Oldham, Smog, Quasi, Sir Richard Bishop and Scout Niblett.

Black Vinyl.

name: V/A: "LADIES CHOICE Vs. VENETO WEST RECORDS" 4 way split LP
description: This super rare, hand numbered, 1-sided LP compilation features 6 tracks by prog-grind insanity mainstays SEAN, THE ABADOX, RONAN CHRIS MURRAY (featuring TERRY BOZZIO) and ANTHONY CURTIS.  Why is this LP only 1-sided?  Because the other side has the cover art etched into it!!!!!  This, hand in hand with some solid hand silkscreened jacket artwork, makes this a total score!

name: BROWN LOBSTER TANK "Tooth Smoke" LP
description: This classic Southern California bands only full length studio release is an absolute must for all fans of Farside, Gameface, The Get Up Kids, or Saves The Day. This LP is long out of print and quantities are limited.

name: SCHLEPROCK "Out of Spite" 12"
description: This five song EP represents Scheleprock's best recordings on the Dr. Strange record label. This was their last effort with the punk label before (however briefly) moving on to a major. The melodic hardcore on this disc is their best indie work and, for a good price, has a place in any collection. Out of print.  Quantities limited.

name: BLACKHOUSE RECORDS "Communication" Hooded Sweatshirt
description: Heavyweight 100% pre-shrunk cotton.  Sizes S, M, L, and XL.  Available in Navy Blue and Black.  Please specify size and color in notes section on payment.

name: SUGAR SKULLS "THE LITTLE DEATH" CD
description:
Close your eyes. Close them against visual overload â€“ the flying toy souvenirs, the homemade commedia dell'arte costumery, the live show detritus that draws in the cheap seaters and thrill seekers â€“ and let your ears do the walking. [For a change.] 

And what floods over you, and your ears, first briefly and then with a rapidly escalating torrent of Mahavishnu, Zappa and light heavyweight prog is this thing that SUGAR SKULLS does on their newest, The Little Death. Mixing equal parts metal, classical, and pop in an experimental mÃ©lange of kitchen sink sonics [yeah, everything BUT], Heidi Nebel [keyboards], Kory Christian [drums], Julie Baldridge [violin], and Ursula Beatrice Stuart [bass], the SUGAR SKULLS in total, will KILL you.
In a good way.

Like they will, on stage, screen and stereo with The Little Death. Like they have at gigs with everyone from SEAN, Sleepytime Gorilla Museum, the Ruins, and Lesbian. Which leads back to The Little Death. And your ears. 

So now open your eyes. 

Ladies and Gentlemen: Seattle's SUGAR SKULLS.

--Eugene S. Robinson (OXBOW, Author, Hydrahead Records)

name: CALL ME RENEGADE "THE UNNAMED EP" CD
description:
The brand spankin' new 7 song CDEP hand numbered and limited to 100 copies!!!!

CALL ME RENEGADE.

Call it a fluke, call it boredom, call it.....luck? I would tack it up to being at the right goddamn place at the right goddamn time, that three degenerates from some pretty reputable punk rock bands, somehow managed to put their brains together (in as random and desolate of a place as tourist-trap Northern Idaho of all places), and write music. Why did this happen? Because number 1, It WAS a FLUKE. Number 2, it WAS (and IS) out of sheer BOREDOM, and number 3, LUCK.

Call Me Renegade is not necessarily the group that will go out of its way to try and impress you. After all, YOU, the walking critic, will always be first in line to cast judgement. After all it is you who decides for yourself, right? You bet your ass you do. The only thing is, they strive to, and just may, impress you. With the speed and technicality of a mechanic after a cheap line of stepped on blow, this band does not break pace, engraining the aggressiveness of the 80's and 90's hardcore punk throwbacks, but all the while purging worthwhile hooks and thought provoking lyric matter without any means of sugar coating.

I mean, they pretty much have no choice. They are from Idaho. If they can't make a mark there....they're fucked.

With members of well established Northwest bands such as Sledgeback, Linus, Scatterbox, Moral Crux, and Nothing Pretty, and having worked off and on over the years on various music projects over the years, these guys are dialed in and prepared to rape your ears sonically....with no lube. Songs are being completed and releases are in the works. You may like it, you may hate it, but wither way, it WORKS. After hearing it, I gotta say it works pretty well if you ask me.

Scotty B.
-www.skullgame.com

name: BEST FRIENDS "S/T" LIMITED ED. 1 SIDED LP/PIC. DISC!
description:
Meet BEST FRIENDS: scott & greg! From Philly, by way of Detroit, BF have been creating their poppy duo fun jams since the first 2 PIECE FEST back in 2008 where they ended their set with an epic memorable huge crowd group hug! You may be used to seeing these 2 dudes playing insane chaotic music from their previous/current bands Enkephalin, Letters in Binary, Slam Wedgehouse, etc.. however, this band is all about the positivity in life. With songs about friendship, skateboarding, the environment, high fiving, optimism, and hugging your friends, BF have created the soundtrack to FUN. These 10 songs are the first songs written by the band, recorded just months before their epic long-awaited relocation to Philly. Think pop punk, post punk, singy, yellin, heavily distorted guitar and super fast hard hitting drums. Technical impressive playing yet still melodic and poppy riffage that just sticks in your head. If you see them live, it is way too hard not to throw your first in the air and party along with the fun and intense feeling that is BEST FRIENDS!

The packaging is the most satanic posi record of all time! Comes on a 1-sided LP with the B side silk screened. Packaging also includes a screened chip board cover and two inserts. 
This record is DIY and it rules hard!!!!!!!

Limited to 333 copies on Black Vinyl.  We were stoked to get a handful of these before they go out of print.  Hand numbered!  get em before they're gone!

name: BUREAUCRATIC DYSTENTARY "OPEN WIDE" LTD ED. CASSETTE.
description:
Officially starting in the summer of 2008, BUREAUCRATIC DYSENTERY is an angry manâ€™s outlet towards the bullshit this world has constructed. expect nothing short of antichristian based attacks on the social whores of pop culture, the attention-seeking snakes of the music "industry" and the self-righteous thieves of politics. 

Limited Quantities available.

name: MORAL CRUX LIVE 2003 CD
description:
** WE JUST FOUND A HANDFUL OF COPIES FROM MOVING LOCATIONS. 12 TO BE EXACT. BACK ON SALE UNTIL GONE. ONCE THEY ARE GONE, THEY ARE GONE. This is a hand numbered, limited to a mere 200 copies live CD of punk rock mainstays MORAL CRUX documenting a prime show played while on tour supporting the “Pop Culture Assassins” CD on Lookout! Records. Captured in its entirety with no edits, straight from the soundboard, this is a great recorded example of Moral Crux in the live element. 24 tracks in all, with songs ranging back as far as their first record, as well as all other records that followed, this is a great collection of Moral Crux at their very best. LIVE! WE ARE DOWN TO THE LAST FEW COPIES OF THIS. Get yours now before they are gone forever! 
All orders come with an added surprise.  Price is postage paid.  Please add $3 for international orders.

name: BLACKHOUSE RECORDS "Sawblade" T-SHIRT
description: New shirts with the new(er) Blackhouse logo on them.  White ink print on the front, blank on back.  Printed on 100% Fruit of The Loom heavyweight pre-shrunk cotton shirts.  Limited quantity available.  Available in S, M, L, and XL.

name: SCATTERBOX "ENEMIES" CD
description:
Sure the provenance is stellar: somewhat up and out of the ashes of hardcoreâ€™s best and brightest, SCATTERBOX has their knotty roots almost knuckle deep into the heart of the fast and frenetic Sound of 1981. Which is where it should be placed if you had any sense, any sense of authenticity or any common sense at all. So, there are bullshit detectors and there are bullshit detectors and if you lived through 1981 the best ones are the ones on the sides of your head. You see the ears are what keep you from thinking [wrongly so] that any band AFTER 1983 was worth any sort of goddamned thing. Like dirty hippies and old jazzbos trying to tell you that ainâ€™t shit happened after Janis or Miles, this type of logic comes from the gut. But it comes from the gut because the ears are not listening.

Which is why this SCATTERBOX shit appeals so much. It has successfully tricked the ear of yesteryear that itâ€™s at Ruthies, or the Wilson Center, or A7, or Rajis. Itâ€™s distilled all of what was cool about hearing this shit for the first time and managed to not make you feel bad about it THIS time. Fucking real deal? Goddamned right. Vintage AND new the music rises above the merely nostalgic to make you want to spray paint the walls, grab your skate, and fuck shit up. And with several and copious nods to post-punk sensibilities [via song titles, design aesthetic], it dawns that SCATTERBOX should be a lot bigger than they are with their heartfelt pre-post take on all of the loud fast rules. But they should be a lot of things probably: not living in Idaho, getting real and paying jobs, cutting out that racket.  However, it would be our sincere hope that they continue existing for the sheer and pure fact that they make hard music to play well look easy and sound like they fucking mean it in the process, which is much, much more than 98 percent of the things youâ€™ll hear this week thatâ€™ll work their way into your brain pans.

Hardcore the way hardcore was played when it meant something to play it. We love these fucking guys. And you should too.

--EUGENE S. ROBINSON (www.eugenesrobinson.com)

name: BLACKHOUSE CASSETTE SERIES VOL. 2: DOLDIS/KEVIN GREENSPON (LIMITED TO 75).
description:
Cassette #2 (shown here) features new previously unreleased noise/drone by DOLDIS (Sweden) and Kevin Geenspon (California/U.S.). Limited to 75 copies, this cassette gets to points so intense that driving is not suggested while listening to this, or doing anything potentially harful for that matter, as this is a lot to take in. Some of the sounds these two artists have produced on this recording is definitely a mindfuck of sorts.

All cassettes come shrinkwrapped, include an insert and sticker, and are hand numbered.

name: V/A: "FEAR POWER GOD" CD
description:
FEAR POWER GOD

The Birth of Tragedy magazine, with a title lifted from the book by Nietzsche of the
same name, marked a certain sort of scabrous and profane looking into the garbaged
heart of our present place in space. Simultaneously and unapologetically intellectual
and resolutely probing, The Birth of Tragedyâ€™s examination of SEX, DEPRESSION,
FEAR, POWER, GOD, LOVE and the almost-soon-to-be-never-released MADNESS
issue formed a sui generis basis for reinterpreting the entire premise of spoken word
recordings: how you said it mattered not, it was all about what you said.
And pulling interviewed artists from the Fear, Power, and God issues of the Birth of
Tragedy was easy, as was aligning their varied interests and approaches. Recording
was full on guerilla style with everybody recording their contribution on whatever they
had available. Art was generated by the inimitable and now artist of some renown Jim
Blanchard and with its white vinyl [also initially released on cassette tape] on the US
releases and black vinyl on the UK releases [the largely suspect Workerâ€™s Playtime
Records], most of the heavy lifting was done.
Right in time to have its distribution done in by the folding of distributor [Jem,
Systematic, and Rough Trade, in pretty short order] after distributor. Fitful later
attempts to reissue the record, most notably by the Swiss German label Skin &
Speech, turned up little and in the intervening years since its 1988 release, in addition
to the deaths of several of some of the original participants, no oneâ€™s approached who
was even remotely interested in resurrecting it in anywhere near to its original glory.
Until now. And this Blackhouse-led initiative--a rare and limited re-issue of a rare and
limited issueâ€”marks the last and fi nal chapter in this glorious and storied enterprise.
Though Allen Ginsberg, Anton LaVey from the Church of Satan, Mr. V.O. Real, and
Whipping Boy have all shuffl ed off of this mortal coil, the remaining participantsâ€”
LYDIA LUNCH, MATT HECKERT formerly of SURVIVAL RESEARCH LABS,
CHARLES MANSON, JELLO BIAFRA and HENRY ROLLINSâ€”are still destroying
anti-culture, one project at a time.
And for this I have to say to some degree weâ€™re all a little bit better off. â€“ Eugene S. Robinson

name: BARACK OBAMA/EXECUTION TECHNIQUES: Blackhouse Limited Cassette Series, Vol. 1.
description:
Alright now it's finally done. Limited to 100 (50 of which will available via pre-order/webstore), this cassette is the first of a four part cassette series from Blackhouse (one for each season) and is hand numbered and assembled. These took a while to finish, but they turned out awesome. 

The first cassette features Barack Obama (Texas) on side A, featuring 10 loud as all hell tracks of thrash, and Execution Techniques (Ohio) on side B, serving up some experimental drone that is definitely one of a kind.

name: MORAL CRUX "S/T" LP+CD Re-Issue (Clear Vinyl)
description: This is one of three different colored vinyl editions of this classic record.  This record marks the 20th Anniversary of Moral Crux's ground-breaking debut album.  Produced and Engineered by Steve Fisk at the now infamous Velvetone Studios, this record is a true document of great catchy punk rock.  Each record comes with gatefold packaging and a full CD version of everything on the record, and also inclues a ton of bonus tracks as well. Limited quantities available.

name: SEAN "Bike Messengers Aren't As Cool As They Think They Are." CD
description: The debut Blackhouse release from Seattle’s Keyboard Grind pioneers SEAN. Picks up right where “Singer’s Ruin…” left off, delivering seven songs of out of control keyboard/drum power-violence. Official release date is June 26th. The pre-order is no longer necessary, but we are still offering the sampler and poster with every order.

name: V/A: "SOLID" 4-Way Split 7" (Black Vinyl)
description: This is a limited edition (500) colored vinyl 4 way split from Citizen Fish, M.D.C., Embrace The Kill, and Mouth Sewn Shut.  Also available in green vinyl (both pressings are both very limited).  Comes with a special insert featuring liner notes by the guys from Citizen Fish.  Not one to miss.

name: Scatterbox "Grenade" T-Shirt
description: Red and white ink on a 100% heavy cotton short sleeve shirt. Only available in black. Available in Medium, Large, and Extra Large. PLEASE SPECIFY SIZE IN ORDER COMMENTS WHEN ORDERING.

name: A Hollywood Legend "Into Open Arms, We Welcome Our Transgressors" CD
description: A dark metal music experiment from Spokane, Washington.  Four songs of unrelenting noise, merging blastbeats, odd time changes, and probably what could be the scariest sounding vocalist we here have ever heard, this is sure to go down as a true N.W. hardcore classic.

name: Scatterbox "Sudden Movements" CD
description: The third (and newest) full length CD from this Northwest punk/thrash outfit.  Produced by Conrad Uno (PUSA, Mudhoney, Gas Huffer, Supersuckers), Scatterbox’s Clickpop Records debut is 11 blasts of hardcore punk obnoxiousness.  Documented as their best record to date.

name: Scatterbox "Infection III" CD
description: The Second full length CD for Blackhouse, Scatterbox  heads for a little bit of a darker side than their previous debut full length “Run Faster, Jump Higher.”  11 tracks clocking in at just over 22 minutes, this is probably their most popular release to date, with tracks featured on various skate and snowboarding videos, as well as a couple of film soundtracks.

name: Scatterbox "Lipstick Stains and Shotgun Shells" Split CD
description: The long out of print and hard to find Split CD between Scatterbox, and now-defunct Spokane punk rock outfit American Zero, who’s members went on to become later on members of Scatterbox, Moral Crux, and The Lashes.  Originally 200 made, we dug this little platter up out of the basement and re-released it.  It is only limited to 500 this time around and 300 are already gone.

name: Sadie Hawkins Rejects "Eat Dead Children" CD
description: The first, and very very killer 5 song CDEP by this now-defunct Seattle horror punk band. Super fast thrash punk songs about killing, zombies, bloodletting, and more with a little hit of a rockabilly sound in the guitar work. Limited quantity of these left.

name: Linus "Lookout For The Whitehouse" CD
description: A six song CDEP by probably one of the only punk rock bands in Idaho. Fast, snotty, political, and unapologetic, this is truly the product of the bored and pissed off. This CD comes with a patch for a cover.

name: Filthy White Trash "Free Ride" CD
description: Thirteen tracks of drunk punk insanity from this Portland, Oregon band.  Members of Valid Effort grace this disc of brutal, obnoxious, snotty punk rock anthem about drugs, beer, fucking, more beer, and mental instability.  Truly destined to become a punk rock classic.

name: SEAN "Singers Ruin Perfectly Good Bands" CD
description: Sean emerges out of the Seattle grind scene to rip your fucking face off!  This two man outfit features members of Scary Bear and The Accused, and is making waves with the (possibly never before done) genre of keyboard grind!  Insanely times bizarro crazy thrash grind with amazing drumming and awesome witty song titles, Sean will not disappoint.  Released on Ladie’s Choice Records in 2005, this is the predecessor to this years’ Blackhouse debut, “Bike Messengers Aren’t As Cool As They Think They Are”, coming this summer.

name: BOYSETSFIRE "Before The Eulogy" CD
description:
Released on November 1, 2005

Remastered, remixed and including bonus cuts never heard before, this is the time for fans to remember one of hardcore's pioneers.
1. One Subject Notebook 
2. Parasite Candy 
3. Three Lefts 
4. Harlot 
5. Vehicle 
6. The Burning Of 
7. Turn The Key 
8. Consider The Numbers 
9. Feudal 
10. Voice Over 
11. The Tyranny of What Everyone Knows 
12. Loser Of The Year Award 
13. Cavity 
14. Holiday In Cambodia 
15. Suckerpunch Training 
16. Rocket Man 
17. No Time Safe 
18. Bucket of Rain 
19. With Cold Eyes 
20. Fashion As A Weapon

name: SAINT JUDE "Always Hard: The Early Recordings" CD
description: Slamming on to the scene with the force of a mac truck, Saint Jude has yet to slow down their onslaught of destruction up and down the Eastern Seaboard. Hailing from the days where hardcore music meant you played faster and harder; Saint Jude doesn't care about your new dunks or your gym shorts, they care about killing your eardrums and leaving you asking for more. (Tor Johnson Records)

name: PINK LINCOLNS "Back From The Pink Room" CD
description: Painstakenly re-mastered to achieve the absolute highest in audio quality. This has been mastered the closest possible to a real "Audiophile" quality. This will blow you away! Out now!

name: Assassination "Decivilize" CD
description: Crushingly loud political speedcore from Sweden! 17 brutal superfast and really well done songs on this CD.  Released on Criminal Records in Sweden as an import item, my personal copy of this CD hasn’t left my car stereo in over a week.  I have a handful available right now for an awesome low price.  Very recommended.

name: Infanticide "Extinction Scheme" CD
description: 23 tracks of crust/grindcore from Sweden.  A great find for fans of Nasum, Pig Destroyer, Agoraphobic Nosebleed, Phobia, and so on.  Originally released on Emetic Records, Blackhouse is proud to be carrying this title and is definitely a great find!

name: Magrudergrind / Shitstorm "Split" CD
description: This is the best split CD EVER. Hundred mile a minutes powerviolence insanity. This is a must. I will stop there, because I could go on for pages. Don’t miss out on this one.

name: The Red Chord "Fused Together In Revolving Doors" CD
description: I only have three of these suckas left.  These are the last copies of the original pressing of this classic record from The Red Chord.  Originally released on Robotic Empire, this is still known as one of their best records and has now been phased out and re-released with some new stuff with it.  Get you hands on this quick, because this is it.  Quantities very limited.  As soon as they are gone, this item will be taken off the page so there won’t be any confusion on availability.  Only one order per customer please.

name: V/A "Mutation" CD
description: One of the few items we distro here at Blackhouse.  Released by Robotic Empire, this 7 band split compilation is probably one of the best concepts for a heavy music comp ever.  Not to mention, it holds a place in my personal top five favorite compilations of all time.  Tracks by Ed Gein, The Minor Times, Abandoned Hearts Club, Garuda, and others.  Very great release not to be passed on.

name: Skarp "Bury Your Dead" CD
description: Extremely brutal thrash punk from this great Seattle band.  Now on Alternative Tentacles, this is their release prior to the label move.  Limited quantities available.

name: Even In Blackouts "Fall of The House of Even" CD
description: For their third full-length release, Even In Blackouts has taken another step in the progression of their sound. Every track on Fall of the House of Even takes a separate approach as if they were different rooms in a decrepit house. Each one of those rooms carries its own occupant, and with that entity comes different musical influences ranging from punk, bluegrass, jazz and R&B. Match the occasionally dark undertones with their always present energy and angelic female voice, and you get EIBâ€™s most inspired release yet.

name: Carbono 14 "Automatas De Nuestra Ignorancia" CD
description: Originally released on Criminal Vexing Grudge, this Spanish import CD is ten tracks of harsh political grind-punk.  Pretty crusty stuff here.  Spanish lyrics, breakneck paced drums, crushing guitars….how can you go wrong?

name: Unabomber "Less Is More" CD
description: Originally released on Voliac in Andorra, this import features Spanish grindcore band Unabomber doing what they do best.  Very fast and unapologetic.

name: Super Timor "Cauchemar D'Esque"
description: Released on Parade Records (Spain), this little import is sixteen songs of incredibly low tuned sludge metal and talk about GRIM! There is a few hints of a bit of a stoner rock influence found in here, but more comparable to Eyehategod or Sleep. This release also features their original demo recordings, as well as their full length release.

name: Noah's Apathy "Something To Divide" CD
description: Noah’s Apathy is like a machine gone mad. Just when you think you have them figured out, they completely change the settings. 2004’s, “The Pacific” left everyone singing the songs for months. Now, they’re back with seven pounding tracks of riff heavy fury. Sure, you might know the words to the chorus, but what about the bridge?! Anyone with a solid taste in music can and will enjoy this band!

name: New Brutalism "1999-2001" CD
description: Born five years ago in Knoxville, TN. Devoted to tonal quality, each instrument played by the members of New Brutalism was hand crafted out of aluminum at their own ABC System Designs. This relase is a retrospective release featuring two out of print and hard to find vinyl only 12”’s, which were both limited to 500.

name: J.F.C. "S/T" CD
description: After playing in and around the Bay Area for a couple of years Oaklandâ€™s JESUS FUCKING CHRIST makes itâ€™s recorded debut with this self titled rager. Coming off more like an old school hardcore thrash attack than the usual “Oakland sound,” JESUS FUCKING CHRIST goes right for the throat. Featuring punk and metal veterans Dave Edwardson from the legendary NEUROSIS on bass and vocals and Larry from THE RICKEETS as well as LARRY AND THE GO NOWHERES on guitar and vocals. For fans of old school Northwest hardcore like the ACCUSED or POION IDEA as well as anyone looking for something like the sounds of the earliest NEUROSIS records.

name: Our Time/The New Threat Split CD
description: Long awaited Jailhouse! Debut from FL legends,”The New Threat”. Teaming up with NJ area hardcore punk rock “Our Time” They bring you 8 tracks of NJ VS FL in your face middle finger punk rock. 1. Our Time: Never Cared 2. Our Time: Broken String 3. Our Time: Our Time 4 Our Time: Running 5. The New Threat: Suicide Today 6 The New Threat: Choices 7. The New Threat: Steadfast 8 The New Threat: Here’s To You * Music Genre: Punk Rock

name: 12 Aullidos "S/T" CD
description:
This band from Spain played destructive power-violence, though the songs are a bit longer than usual for that genre. You know the drill, slow building sludge erupts into blitzing fast thrash with sop-on-a-dime stops. These guys were far from being just PV clones though as there is a lot of originality in the song writing, bolstered all around by a strong studio recording… and the artwork is excellent.”—Short Fast and Loud Magazine

	Originally from Six Weeks Records.  Limited quantities available.

name: Fake Problems / Sedona Split CD
description: South Florida Indie-Pop sensation Fake Problems team up with North Carolina’s greatest technical indie rock group to date. Fake Problems (who also have a 7” out on Sabot Records) is known for their relentless touring schedule, while Sedona is known for their apperances on Deep Elm Records compilations…

name: Mahakala "S/T" CD
description: One of the newest releases on our friends at Parade Records (Spain), this is one seriously loud and brutal release. With five songs and a production quality and mix that fits this release absolutely PERFECT, Mahakala is similar to that of High on Fire with some Man Is The Bastard and “His Hero Is Gone” thrown into the mix. Not a release to miss out on!

name: Possession "Anoxia" CD
description: The debut CD from this extremely powerful and political grind/metal band from Spain. Full on At the Gates meets Neurosis!  Spanish import CD from Criminal Vexing Grudge Records.

name: Teenage Rehab "Goodbye Sanity" CD
description:
Brand spankin new album showcasing the old school straight forward melodic punk rock, while bringing a change of attitude.

	“Goodbye Sanity” is a journey into poverty, drug abuse, hopelessness and mental illness. It is a whirlwind ride through a mind spinning out of control. In five tracks, Teenage Rehab successfully paints an out-of-sequence epic tale of a man who is fed up and vows to go out swinging.

name: Lair of The Minotaur "The Ultimate Destroyer" CD
description: A epic and undeniable monolith hath been unleashed upon thee earth… Behold! The second album from Chicagos’ Lair of the Minotaur. The Ulitmate Destroyer bulldozes down the same path as their critically acclaimed and now classic debut: Carnage. Blistering riffs, and skull-crushing rhythms played with a apocalyptic aesthetic and complimented perfectly with horrific lyrical vengeance. Ultimate Destroyer in whole is faster, yet slower and more vicious then anything the band has previously done. From the maniacal speed of: “Lord of Butchery to the Death Metal obsessed groove of “Behead the Gorgon” to the mammoth doom of album closer: The Hydra Coils Upon This Wicker Mountain” this album smothers alot of purely METAL, hallowed ground. Obtain this cd and go see them live in April with Unearthly Trance!!

name: V/A "For Documentation Only Records Compilation 2" CD
description: Sampler compilation from the For Documentation Only Recordings label.  Ten tracks from Noah’s Apathy, Even In Blackouts, Unlucky Atlas, The Antiques, Jenji, Fake Problems, and Ars Phoenix.

name: RHYTHM COLLISION "Clobberer" LP
description: That's a strong statement...but I mean it wholeheartedly. Well, I don't know about "pop", when I think "pop"-punk, I think stuff that's a bit more Ramones influenced...this, being from Cali is obviously more Cali-influenced. ANYWAY...I'm getting off the point here. There are certainly bands more famous than Rhythm Collision, bands which were more consistent throughout the course of their career (you can never go wrong with mid-period Screeching Weasel records, The Queers 'Love Songs for the Retarded', or anything by Green Day - from '39/Smooth' right through 'Insomniac')....but, in the 15+ years I've been listening to punk rock, I have NEVER heard a better catchy punk record than Rhythm Collision's "Clobberer". Full of energy, and simple riffs that will stick in your head forever. This record is on eternal repeat, and it's awful that this band never got the respect they deserved. I saw them once, with about 30 people in the audience, and they blew me away. Every song is a concise punk rock masterpiece. This is the blueprint, and although their other records are good, too -- this is the ONE....their one bonafide moment of genius.  -J. Kaplan.

name: New Brutalism "Territorial Reconstruction" LP
description: Unlike their contemporaries, New Brutalism creates their music by creating their own ABC Systems instruments entirely out of aluminum. They even make their own cabinets and amplifiers. If there was such a thing as DIY, New Brutalism has taken it to a whole new level. The result of these processes is a 6 song EP, three songs written in D and three songs written in E. As such, they have decided to have a D-side and an E-side to the record, so thoughtful that it hurt.

name: Divisia "Wifebeater" LP
description: (Pessimiser)  Now out of print, Anaheim, California’s female fronted speed-core freaks Divisia wrench out their second full length record.  Similar to the feel of early Profan Existence bands filled with breakneck-speed, raw production, and socially and politically conscious lyrics. Great stuff.

name: Bollweevils "Weevilive" LP (colored vinyl/Limited to 500)
description: Man were we STOKED to get our hands on a handful of the last few copies of this. The Bollweevils infamous riot-inducing show at The Metro in Chicago that caused a drastic change in the way The Metro operates, caught on a limited edition run of 500 and on colored vinyl no less!!! Crucial.

name: Bollweevils "Heavyweight" LP
description: 1995 album – more aggressive hardcore punk rock 13 tracks! The notorious album with the cover of Bad Brains “Pay To Cum.” a must if you love the DESCENDENTS, NAKED RAYGUN, ALL & more stuff melodic like that!

name: V/A "Direction" LP
description: Old compilation originally on Polyvinyl Records.  Limited to 500.  These are numbered and feature tracks by Walker, Gus, Gainer, Braid, Ezra Pound, Tomorrow, and many others.  Limited quantities.

name: Sinkhole "Space Freak" LP
description: Possibly one of the greatest pop-punk bands of all time, Sinkhole’s crowning moment “Space Freak” is a punk rock classic, fusing influences of Jawbreaker, Doc Hopper, and Descendents to create something that is definitely their own, and has not been done nearly as well ever since.  Limited quantities available.  This record is now out of print and we are proud to have the last few copies of this on vinyl available for you.

name: The Feds "Chicago Bureau" LP
description: Featuring the guitar player from the Bollweevils, The Feds powerhouse first release “Chicago Bureau” is 12 tracks of some seriously solid, hook filled punk songs that really deliver.  Originally released almost a decade ago, we were lucky enough to score the last few copies of this before it becomes lost in obscurity….well….or before they do a repress.  Haha…. a great release.

name: Gameface "Three To Get Ready" LP
description:
Without a doubt, this is one of the most incredible and moving punk records ever released. Gameface’s “Three To Get Ready” has more emotion and drive than any of the “emo” that’s out there. Do you like JimmyEatWorld, Texas is the Reason, or any band like them? Where do you think they got their sound from? This album rocks from start to finish, with interesting music and thoughtful lyrics throughout. Certainly the best thing to come out of Orange County, and I guarantee it will stay in your CD player for weeks on end. Beautiful, powerful punk rock.

	Listen for Gwen Stefani lending vocals on the closing cover track.

name: F.Y.P. "Come Home Smelly" 10"
description: The final bow from punk rock’s toilet-tard terrors dribbles down the leg of a decade in action, soiling its shoes for the final time. An eight-track poo-poo party featuring founding member and frontshit TODD “THE CLOD” CONGELLIERE along with backing fall-down from JOSH FREESE (VANDALS, DEVO, GUNS ‘N ROSES), and SEAN COLE. Naturally it was produced by BLAG DAHLIA (with some help from Freese).

name: New Brutalism "Turbo Record" 7"
description: A limited edition 45 RPM 7” single from New Brutalism released by ABC Group Documentation. Very complex and well thought out, this is a great example of technically astounding sounding indie rock genius. For fans of Isis, Grails, Mono, and Belt of Vapor. Quantities are limited.

name: Paris, Texas "S/T" 7"
description: Rare single from 1999. “Silver” is a different version of the song which also appears on So You Think It’s Hot Here?

name: Rotten Sound / Mastic Scum "Seeds of Hate" Split 7"
description: A German import we distro.  There’s not many of these left around and we, infact, only have a handful left so get ‘em before they’re gone!  Brutal crust grindcore from Europe.

name: V/A "Drum Machine Madness" 7" COLORED VINYL
description: Exclusive tracks from Agoraphobic Nosebleed, Wadge, Nemo, Pilgrim Fetus (Ultimate Warriors members) and Alien Crucifixion (Born Under Saturn members). The ANb track is an outtake/unused song from the split “Poacher Diaries” sessions they used for the Converge split, and all the other tracks are equally blistering. This is an old 1-sided 7” compilation with this weird full-color tinted kind of paper, and lime green vinyl limited to 744 copies. The mylar bags we got on these few copies are a bit cracked, but overall these are in excellent condition and a great way to check out a weird old release of ours!

name: I.A.F. / Rahakka "Split" 7" IMPORT
description: This EP represents the final material from both bands. I.A.F. played brutal Scandi-crust while Rahakka played alcoholic and ferocious crust punk in the style of Riisteyet and Kaaos.  This record is an import and we only have a few left.

name: Masskontrol Warpath 7" (Colored vinyl)
description: Four breakneck paced songs of politically charged hardcore punk from Portland, Oregon’s MASSKONTROL. Pressed on Red vinyl and includes a full insert and lyric sheet. (Havoc)

name: Brother Inferior / N.O.T.A Split 7" (Colored vinyl)
description: Two songs from two insane legendary punk bands.  Brother inferior incorporates a little more of an anarcho punk feel with a fast obnoxious tinge to it, where N.O.T.A. switch it up with lightning fast speed thrash to really deliver a great split release.  Pressed on grey marbled vinyl with full insert.  (Havoc)

name: Assembly of God "Submission Obedience Denial" 7"
description: Eight blisteringly fast songs fill this 7” to the brim. Tulsa, Oklahomas ASSEMBLY OF GOD blow through this set of earbleeding punk rock and almost exceed the capacity of this records allowable time limit. Definitely not one to be missed. (Havoc)

name: Cluster Bomb Unit "And The Dirty Little Weapons" 7" (colored vinyl)
description: Germany’s political hardcore outfit CLUSTER BOMB UNIT are back with five songs to raw, unapologetic hardcore punk rock pressed on a grey marbled vinyl 7” record. Limited quantities available. (Havoc)

name: Blackhouse Records T-Shirt
description:
Get your “street cred” here yo…..
White silkscreened ink on heavy 100% cotton shirt.  Available in S,M,L, and XL.

name: Scatterbox "Mexican Wrestling" T-Shirt
description: New Scatterbox shirt available.  Yellow ink available on black, navy, and brown.  Please specify what color and what size when ordering.  Available in S,M,L,XL, and 2XL.

name: MORAL CRUX beanie
description: Embroidered logo on a heavyweight black beanie.  One size fits all.  These turned out awesome.

name: MORAL CRUX Baseball Cap.
description: Embroidered logo on a flexfit one-size-fits-all high quality black baseball cap.  The same logo design as on the beanie.....but on a baseball cap!

name: S. ROZELL "ESCOBAR" 13"X19" PRINT LTD. TO 25
description:
Limited edition color print measuring 13"X19" by Scatterbox and Moral Crux Drummer Scott Rozell.  Limited to a small quantity of 25, these are all hand numbered and signed and ready for framing.  All prints are shipped rolled in a tube with kraft paper to ensure utmost care and safe delivery.

***This item can only ship by itself, hence no shiping discount for ordering other items.

name: Sean "Bike Messengers" POSTER
description: Poster for the “Bike Messengers Aren’t As Cool As They Think They Are” release on Blackhouse (BH999-20) Full color offset print on a heavy glossy poster stock.  12”x18”. Folded or rolled.  Please add $1.00 extra to shipping to get it mailed in a tube.
